resume_text:
Nithisshkrishna K S
153 Affinity Lane Apartment B-S, Buffalo, New York 14215
+1 716-910-9712 nithissh683@gmail.com linkedin.com/in/nithisshkrishna/ github.com/NithisshKrishna
Professional Summary
Analytical and detail-oriented Data Science graduate student with hands-on experience in data analysis, predictive
modeling, and data visualization. Skilled in SQL, Python, R, and advanced data analytics tools, with a strong
foundation in machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and statistical modeling. Experienced in building and
deploying scalable applications, integrating relational databases, and presenting insights through interactive
dashboards. Seeking a data analyst or data scientist role in a growth-focused organization to apply analytical
expertise and drive business impact
Education
State University of New York at Buffalo August 2024 – Present
Master of Science in Data Science — CGPA: 3.75 Buffalo, New York
Rajalakshmi Engineering College August 2020 – May 2024
Bachelor of Technology in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning — CGPA: 3.75 Chennai, Tamil Nadu
Experience
International Software Solutions Inc June 2025 – August 2025
Data Analysis and Web development Intern Greenbelt, Maryland
–Designed and deployed a school management web application using Django, implementing REST APIs, ORM-based
models, and role-based user authentication.
–Enhanced system scalability by integrating relational databases, optimizing queries, and ensuring seamless
backend–frontend communication.
–Performed feature engineering and exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large datasets using Python (Pandas, NumPy,
Seaborn, Plotly) to uncover actionable insights.
–Built and optimized machine learning models (classification/regression) with Scikit-learn/XGBoost, applying
cross-validation, hyperparameter tuning, and performance monitoring.
Vlog Innovations January 2023 – March 2023
Machine Learning Intern Chennai, Tamil Nadu
–Gained hands-on experience in developing and optimizing end-to-end machine learning pipelines.
–Collaborated with a team to integrate machine learning models into real-world projects, enhancing model performance.
–Contributed to data analysis, model deployment, and project execution using agile methodologies to improve efficiency.
Projects
Ordinal (Mental Health Awareness WebApp) |Python, HTML, JavaScript May 2023
–Designed and developed a prototype mental health web application with 5+ core features , including articles, audio,
videos, quizzes, and journaling.
–Built and integrated 3 interactive modules (quizzes, journaling, guided audio) to simulate trauma recovery support
and boost engagement in testing scenarios.
–Conducted 10+ rounds of testing with sample data and scenarios, achieving a 100% pass rate on all core
functionality.
Customer Attrition Prediction |Python, PySpark, Big Data May 2024
–Built a big data–driven web application to analyze 1M+ telecom records , enabling exploration of customer behavior
and attrition patterns.
–Integrated Apache Spark for large-scale data processing and implemented ensemble voting classifiers, boosting
prediction accuracy by 20% .
–Delivered forecasting insights through visualization and reporting, identifying 3 key drivers of customer churn to
guide retention strategies.
School Management System |Django, PostgreSQL, Data Analytics, Plotly June 2025
–Designed and deployed a Django-based school management system with role-based authentication for 4+ user types
(students, teachers, parents, administrators).
–Developed a PostgreSQL relational schema with 6+ interconnected entities (Students, Teachers, Courses,
Enrollments, Grades, Attendance) ensuring data integrity via constraints and foreign keys.
–Built 5+ interactive dashboards using Plotly, Seaborn, and Matplotlib to track academic performance, attendance
trends, and student outcomes.
–Automated notifications for grades, attendance alerts, and event updates, and implemented predictive analytics to
forecast student performance with 85% accuracy in testing .
Extracurricular Activities
–Volunteer at IAD DAYS 2025, Institute for Artificial Intelligence and Data Science (IAD), University at
Buffalo
∗Supported the organization and execution of the Artificial Intelligence and Data Science Symposium, a prominent
event drawing national scholars in AI, Machine Learning, and High Performance Computing.
∗Managed logistics and technology setups for the workshop, ensuring tools and environments were prepared for
hands-on learning experiences.
– National and State Level Rifle Shooter (2017 – 2020)
∗Represented Tamil Nadu as a member of the Sports Development Authority of Tamil Nadu (SDAT).
∗Competed at the national level, demonstrating precision, focus, and dedication in rifle shooting.
∗Secured Silver Medal at State Championship (2019), demonstrating focus, consistency, and ability to perform under
high-pressure environments — skills I bring to data-driven problem-solving..
Publications
Clustering Comparison of Customer Attrition Using Machine Learning Algorithms
International Journal of Innovative Science and Research Technology, Volume 9, Issue 4, April 2024
Certifications
–Tata Data Visualization: Empowering Business with Effective Insights Job Simulation on Forage
(February 2025)
–Completed a simulation involving creating data visualizations using Tableau, preparing questions for client meetings, and
developing visuals to support decision-making.
Technical Skills
•Languages & Frameworks: Python, R, SQL, Matlab, Django
•Tools & Platforms: Tableau, Git, Docker, Excel, PostgreSQL
•Data Science & AI Skills: Statistics, Data Visualization, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing
(NLP), Computer Vision

strengths: Strong academic background with good GPAs in relevant fields (Data Science, AI/ML).
Excellent project section demonstrating hands-on experience with diverse tools and clear, quantifiable impacts (e.g., 20% accuracy boost, 100% pass rate).
Comprehensive technical skills list, with strong evidence for most core data science and web development technologies.
Clear career objective and professional summary that aligns with target roles.
weaknesses: Learning Focus: Nithisshkrishna, your resume showcases a strong foundation in data science and impressive projects with clear impacts. To make your resume highly effective, prioritize updating all dates to reflect actual past or current engagements. Additionally, strengthen your internship descriptions by using powerful action verbs and quantifying achievements, and ensure every skill listed has clear supporting evidence to demonstrate your capabilities to potential employers.
Critical timeline inconsistencies where several experiences, projects, and certifications are listed with future dates.
Some experience bullet points lack specific action verbs and quantifiable outcomes, particularly in the earlier internship.
A few listed technical skills lack supporting evidence in the experience or projects sections.
✗ Shortlist Decision: Would NOT recommend for interview

Critical honesty issue: Multiple instances of listing future-dated 'Experience' (International Software Solutions Inc, June 2025 – August 2025), 'Projects' (School Management System, June 2025), 'Extracurricular Activities' (IAD DAYS 2025), and 'Certifications' (Tata Data Visualization, February 2025) as if they are completed.
Weak ownership and generic descriptions in the 'Vlog Innovations' internship, lacking specific individual contributions, tools, or impact.
Inclusion of outdated and marginally relevant extracurricular activities ('National and State Level Rifle Shooter') that consume valuable resume space without contributing to professional relevance.

keyword_and_skills.issue: Some bullet points lack structure - add action verbs and outcomes
keyword_and_skills.recommended_fix: Start bullet points with strong action verbs like: Developed, Implemented, Led, Designed, Optimized, Achieved, Managed
keyword_and_skills.reason: Improves ATS keyword matching and demonstrates relevant expertise

keyword_and_skills.issue: Resume appears to target junior positions
keyword_and_skills.recommended_fix: Ensure your skills and experience align with junior role expectations. Add relevant certifications or advanced skills if targeting higher levels.
keyword_and_skills.reason: Aligns resume presentation with career level and target roles

content_and_bullets.reason: Highlights business value and measurable outcomes

content_and_bullets.issue: Weak ownership signals and generic descriptions in 'Vlog Innovations' internship experience.
content_and_bullets.recommended_fix: Rephrase bullets to use strong action verbs, quantify achievements, and specify tools/technologies used, focusing on what *you* specifically did and the *outcome* of your actions. Even in a collaborative environment, highlight your distinct role. | Example: Developed and documented an end-to-end machine learning pipeline using scikit-learn for [specific task], reducing manual data preparation time by 10% and improving model iteration speed.
content_and_bullets.reason: Human Reviewer: Bullets like 'Gained hands-on experience,' 'Collaborated with a team,' and 'Contributed to' are passive and fail to convey specific individual achievements, tools used, or the direct impact made. This makes the experience appear less substantive and makes it difficult for a reviewer to understand the candidate's personal contributions and capabilities.

projects_and_experience.reason: Demonstrates substantive experience rather than surface-level claims

projects_and_experience.recommended_fix: Remove all entries with future dates from 'Experience,' 'Projects,' and 'Certifications.' If an internship offer is accepted but not yet started, it can be briefly mentioned under a 'Pending Experience' or 'Education' section, clearly stating its future start date and expected duration, without detailed bullet points of work yet to be done. Similarly, 'projects' not yet started should not appear. | Example: Nithisshkrishna K S | Accepted Offer: Data Analysis and Web Development Intern, International Software Solutions Inc (June 2025 – August 2025). (This clarifies the future nature without detailing work not yet performed).
projects_and_experience.reason: Human Reviewer: This is a fundamental breach of trust. A strict human reviewer (especially a hiring manager) assumes all listed experiences are factual and completed. Listing future activities as current or past demonstrates a severe lack of integrity, misrepresentation, and would likely lead to immediate disqualification. It suggests an attempt to dishonestly inflate qualifications.

structure_and_formatting.recommended_fix: Use a clear hierarchy: Contact → Summary → Skills → Experience → Education → Projects
structure_and_formatting.reason: Follows standard resume format expected by recruiters and ATS

ats_compatibility.issue: Inclusion of outdated and marginally relevant extracurricular activity.
ats_compatibility.recommended_fix: Either remove the activity entirely to allocate more space to recent and relevant experiences, or, if absolutely desired, condense it into a single line under a dedicated 'Interests' or 'Hobbies' section without attempting to justify its professional relevance. | Example: National and State Level Rifle Shooter (2017-2020) - Secured Silver Medal at State Championship.
ats_compatibility.reason: Human Reviewer: While impressive, an achievement from 2017-2020 (ending before B.Tech studies began) for rifle shooting has minimal direct relevance to a Data Science/Analyst role. The attempt to force a connection to 'data-driven problem-solving' is generic and unconvincing. Resume space is valuable and should be optimized for recent, relevant, and impactful professional or academic experiences.

trusted_signals: Strong technical execution and quantifiable impact in 'Ordinal' and 'Customer Attrition Prediction' projects, demonstrating solid data science skills and ownership.
Publication in a journal indicates academic rigor and ability to contribute to the field.
Clear listing of relevant technical skills (Python, SQL, R, Spark, ML/DL) that align with data roles.
red_flags: Critical honesty issue: Multiple instances of listing future-dated 'Experience' (International Software Solutions Inc, June 2025 – August 2025), 'Projects' (School Management System, June 2025), 'Extracurricular Activities' (IAD DAYS 2025), and 'Certifications' (Tata Data Visualization, February 2025) as if they are completed.
Weak ownership and generic descriptions in the 'Vlog Innovations' internship, lacking specific individual contributions, tools, or impact.
Inclusion of outdated and marginally relevant extracurricular activities ('National and State Level Rifle Shooter') that consume valuable resume space without contributing to professional relevance.
learning_takeaways: Always ensure all listed experiences, projects, and certifications are *completed* and accurately dated. Listing future activities as past or present is a critical honesty violation.
Quantify your impact and specify your contributions using strong action verbs. Avoid generic phrases that do not highlight your individual ownership and technical involvement.

Prioritize relevance and recency in all resume sections. Only include extracurriculars or older achievements if they are highly relevant or exceptionally impressive and cannot be conveyed elsewhere, or condense them significantly.

improvements_applied: Enhanced resume content with LLM while preserving structure
Created PDF-rebuild version with EXACT line count preservation
Improved wording for clarity and professionalism
Strengthened action verbs and technical language
Added impact context without inventing metrics
Maintained all dates, roles, and original information
Generated pixel-perfect enhanced PDF with preserved layout
